definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: The first-order cancellation is one kind of classical idea for the purpose of canceling stationary target cancellation.
sentences.chinese: 一次相消技術是一種經典的固定點目標對消方法。

sentences.english: On the cabin floor there are cargo tiedown points.
sentences.chinese: 在機艙地板上安裝有貨物固定點。

sentences.english: Its lower fixed point is absolute zero.
sentences.chinese: 其低端固定點溫度是絕對零度。

sentences.english: Used to indicate that something is exceptionally solid, e. g. an anchor, a hold. See also bombproof.
sentences.chinese: 常用來表示一個固定點或把手點非常堅固。

sentences.english: A corruption of "bombproof" meaning very secure.
sentences.chinese: 指非常穩固安全的把手點或固定點。

sentences.english: The body travels in an ellipse, the fixed point being at on focus.
sentences.chinese: 物體沿着固定點在一個焦點上的橢圓軌道運動。

pinyin: Shi4 jie4 Mao4 yi4 Zhong1 xin1

definition: vehicle/(more specifically) mobility vehicle (mobility scooter, electric wheelchair, Segway etc)
on call/always available/ready at all times
